main event: A CAP pilot and observer saw a round silver ball flying at high speed at 1000' altitude during a search mission.
interesting points: The observation was made by a CAP pilot and observer while flying at an altitude of 600',The sighting occurred between 1015 and 1036 on 19 October 1952,The object was described as a round silver ball,The object was flying at great speed and the pilot noted its altitude as 1000', The report concluded that the sighted object was probably a balloon.
